content.text: This is where you set up the Contact Settings for your Vendors, so you can define the Vendor Types and any custom fields:
Vendor Types
Add Vendor Types
Edit Vendor Types
Custom fields
Add Custom Fields
See the Vendor Contact Settings in Action
Navigate to Settings > Module Settings > Contact > Vendor.  The vendor tab displays under contact settings.
The Vendor Tab in contact settings is where Vendor Types are defined. Use these fields when creating new vendors for better organization, making them easier to find and filter.
Vendor Types are used to group vendors in the Vendor Management screen.
Click the vendor types + button.
In the Name field, enter in the vendor types.
Click off the field and it is saved.
Click on the existing vendor type and the pop-up displays.
If you want to rename the labor code, then complete the following:
Click the Rename button.
Edit the vendor type.
Click the Rename  icon to save.
If you need to delete the vendor type, click the Delete button. If the customer status is in use then the system will not let you delete the vendor type.
You can add extra custom fields to the Vendor Contact and these will display in the Vendor form.
Click the custom fields + button and the Custom Fields dialog displays.
From the list select a custom field. If you need to create a new custom field, then see Create or Edit Custom Fields.
Click the Add button and the custom field is added.

content.title: Make a Custom Field mandatory or optional

content.text: To make the field mandatory, click the Not Required  icon and change it to Required   or vice versa.

content.title: Delete a Custom Field from the Employee Settings

content.text: Click the X icon, next to the custom field's name.
Hover over the custom field.
Click the double ellipsis icon and then drag and drop the custom field up or down to change the order.

content.title: See the Vendor Contact Settings in Action

content.text: When you have set up the vendor contact settings and custom fields, then you will see these in the Vendor's Edit form.
Navigate to Vendors.
Click the vendor's name and the edit form displays.
Here you see the (A) Vendor drop-down contains the types and the (B) Custom Info contains the custom fields.
Learn more about how to add or edit vendor records in the Vendor module.
